intro: Loasa ranunculifolia, commonly known as the velvetleaf loasa, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring. It typically grows in moist, woodland habitats and can reach heights of up to 2 meters. Loasa ranunculifolia is often found in shaded areas and is known for its ornamental value in gardens.
